name: Migaloo The White Whale
description:
I saw so many whales in 2013 I thought it was about time I painted them.

While doing my research online about humpback whales I came across something really inspiring.

On 28th June 1991, an all-white whale was spotted passing Byron Bay, Australia's most easterly point. Named Migaloo by the indigenous community in Queensland, at the time the whale was the only documented all-white humpback whale in the world.

For me Migaloo is symbolic of the vulnerability of whale populations. This series of paintings, focused on Migaloo, tells the story of his journey up and down the coast.

Since 2013 Migaloo, whales and other crustacea have become a symbol in my work for all living creatures and the fragility of the environment.
